Streams in the Desert - March 18 🌿📖✨

He answered nothing (Mark 15:3). 🙏🤐

There is no scene in the Bible more powerful than the silent Savior, who didn’t say a word to those who were accusing Him. 🕊️🤍 He could have stopped them with just one look or word, but He chose to stay silent. 🤫✨ He let them do their worst, standing in THE POWER OF STILLNESS—God’s holy, silent Lamb. 🐑💖

There is a kind of stillness that lets God work for us. 🙏🌌 It’s a stillness that stops us from trying to fix everything ourselves, from defending ourselves, or from planning every detail. 🛑🤯 Instead, it trusts God to handle the situation with His perfect love. 💖🙌

Often, we miss God’s help because we try to fight our own battles. ⚔️😔 Let’s ask God for this silent power and a spirit that trusts Him completely. 🙏🕊️ When life’s struggles are over, people will remember us like they remember the calm morning dew, 🌅💧 the gentle sunlight, ☀️🌿 the evening breeze, 🌬️🌙 the Lamb of Calvary, 🐑✝️ and the peaceful, holy Dove. 🕊️✨

-- A. B. Simpson

The day when Jesus stood alone 🙍‍♂️🌄
And felt the hearts of men like stone, 🪨💔
And knew He came but to atone ✝️💖
That day "He held His peace." 🤐🕊️
They witnessed falsely to His word, 🗣️❌📖
They bound Him with a cruel cord, 🔗😢
And mockingly proclaimed Him Lord; 👑🤡
"But Jesus held His peace." 🤐🕊️
They spat upon Him in the face, 🤮👤
They dragged Him on from place to place, 🚶‍♂️➡️🚶‍♂️
They heaped upon Him all disgrace; 🗑️😔
"But Jesus held His peace." 🤐🕊️
My friend, have you for far much less, 🤔👫
With rage, which you called righteousness, 😡⚖️
Resented slights with great distress? 😤😩
Your Saviour "held His peace." 🤐🕊️
-- L. S. P.

I remember hearing Bishop Whipple, known as "The Apostle of the Indians," say: "For thirty years, I’ve tried to see the face of Christ in those I disagreed with." 🌟👳‍♂️🙏

When we have this attitude, we’ll avoid being narrow-minded or too quick to judge. 🚫🧠⚡ We’ll also avoid anger and anything that could harm our testimony for Jesus, who came not to destroy lives but to save them. 💕✝️🙌

-- W. H. Griffith Thomas
